intro: Tithymalus serrulatus, commonly known as the serrated tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely serrated leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, a typical feature of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
